labels.analysis: The MCP Server essentially acts as an AppleScript-driven automation and control hub for macOS, enabling AI applications to interact with and manipulate various macOS system components through standardized AppleScript tools. Its core functionality revolves around managing system settings, file operations, notifications, and integrating with macOS native applications like Calendar, Mail, Messages, Notes, and more. The available tools overwhelmingly focus on automating and enhancing productivity by leveraging macOS's native capabilities, making it a powerful tool for system automation and integration with AI agents.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Operating System" is chosen because the server's main functionality is to control and manage macOS system functions, such as volume control, app management, battery status, and system settings. Secondary labels "Daily Productivity" and "File Management" are selected as the tools significantly enhance user productivity through calendar management, file operations, clipboard handling, and automation of repetitive tasks. No custom label is needed as the predefined categories adequately cover the server's functionality.

tools.name: system_volume
tools.description: [System control and information] Set system volume

tools.name: system_get_frontmost_app
tools.description: [System control and information] Get the name of the frontmost application

tools.name: system_launch_app
tools.description: [System control and information] Launch an application

tools.name: system_quit_app
tools.description: [System control and information] Quit an application

tools.name: system_toggle_dark_mode
tools.description: [System control and information] Toggle system dark mode

tools.name: system_get_battery_status
tools.description: [System control and information] Get battery level and charging status

tools.name: calendar_add
tools.description: [Calendar operations] Add a new event to Calendar

tools.name: calendar_list
tools.description: [Calendar operations] List all events for today

tools.name: finder_get_selected_files
tools.description: [Finder and file operations] Get currently selected files in Finder

tools.name: finder_search_files
tools.description: [Finder and file operations] Search for files by name

tools.name: finder_quick_look_file
tools.description: [Finder and file operations] Preview a file using Quick Look

tools.name: clipboard_get_clipboard
tools.description: [Clipboard management operations] Get current clipboard content

type.description: Type of clipboard content to get

tools.name: clipboard_set_clipboard
tools.description: [Clipboard management operations] Set clipboard content

tools.name: clipboard_clear_clipboard
tools.description: [Clipboard management operations] Clear clipboard content

tools.name: notifications_toggle_do_not_disturb
tools.description: [Notification management] Toggle Do Not Disturb mode using keyboard shortcut

tools.name: notifications_send_notification
tools.description: [Notification management] Send a system notification

tools.name: iterm_paste_clipboard
tools.description: [iTerm terminal operations] Paste clipboard content into iTerm

tools.name: iterm_run
tools.description: [iTerm terminal operations] Run a command in iTerm

newWindow.description: Whether to open in a new window (default: false)

tools.name: mail_create_email
tools.description: [Mail operations] Create a new email in Mail.app

tools.name: mail_list_emails
tools.description: [Mail operations] List emails from a specified mailbox in Mail.app

mailbox.description: Name of the mailbox to list emails from (e.g., 'Inbox', 'Sent')

account.description: Name of the account to search in (e.g., 'iCloud', 'Gmail', 'Exchange'). If not specified, searches all accounts with preference for iCloud.

count.description: Maximum number of emails to retrieve

unreadOnly.description: Only show unread emails if true

tools.name: mail_get_email
tools.description: [Mail operations] Get a specific email by search criteria from Mail.app

mailbox.description: Name of the mailbox to search in (e.g., 'Inbox', 'Sent')

account.description: Name of the account to search in (e.g., 'iCloud', 'Gmail', 'Exchange'). If not specified, searches all accounts with preference for iCloud.

subject.description: Subject text to search for (partial match)

sender.description: Sender email or name to search for (partial match)

dateReceived.description: Date received to search for (format: YYYY-MM-DD)

unreadOnly.description: Only search unread emails if true

includeBody.description: Include email body in the result if true

tools.name: pages_create_document
tools.description: [Pages document operations] Create a new Pages document with plain text content (no formatting)

content.description: The plain text content to add to the document (no formatting)

tools.name: shortcuts_run_shortcut
tools.description: [Shortcuts operations] Run a shortcut with optional input. Uses Shortcuts Events to run in background without opening the app.

name.description: Name of the shortcut to run

input.description: Optional input to provide to the shortcut

tools.name: shortcuts_list_shortcuts
tools.description: [Shortcuts operations] List all available shortcuts with optional limit

limit.description: Optional limit on the number of shortcuts to return

tools.name: messages_list_chats
tools.description: [iMessage operations] List available iMessage and SMS chats

tools.name: messages_get_messages
tools.description: [iMessage operations] Get messages from the Messages app

limit.description: Maximum number of messages to retrieve

tools.name: messages_search_messages
tools.description: [iMessage operations] Search for messages containing specific text or from a specific sender

searchText.description: Text to search for in messages

sender.description: Search for messages from a specific sender (phone number or email)

chatId.description: Limit search to a specific chat ID

limit.description: Maximum number of messages to retrieve

daysBack.description: Limit search to messages from the last N days

tools.name: messages_compose_message
tools.description: [iMessage operations] Open Messages app with a pre-filled message to a recipient or automatically send a message

recipient.description: Phone number or email of the recipient

auto.description: Automatically send the message without user confirmation

tools.name: notes_create
tools.description: [Apple Notes operations] Create a new note with optional formatting

content.description: Content of the note, can include markdown-like syntax for formatting

format.description: Formatting options for the note content

lists.description: Enable list formatting (- item or 1. item)

tools.name: notes_createRawHtml
tools.description: [Apple Notes operations] Create a new note with direct HTML content

html.description: Raw HTML content for the note

tools.name: notes_list
tools.description: [Apple Notes operations] List all notes or notes in a specific folder

folder.description: Optional folder name to list notes from

tools.name: notes_get
tools.description: [Apple Notes operations] Get a specific note by title

title.description: Title of the note to retrieve

folder.description: Optional folder name to search in

tools.name: notes_search
tools.description: [Apple Notes operations] Search for notes containing specific text

query.description: Text to search for in notes (title and body)

folder.description: Optional folder name to search in

limit.description: Maximum number of results to return (default: 5)

includeBody.description: Whether to include note body in results (default: true)

server_info_crawled.name: AppleScript MCP Server
server_info_crawled.author: @femto/applescript-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Enable AI applications to control macOS system functions, manage files, handle notifications, and automate workflows through a standardized AppleScript interface. Seamlessly integrate calendar, clipboard, Finder, notifications, system controls, mail, messages, notes, and more into your LLM-powered tools. Enhance productivity by leveraging macOS capabilities directly from your AI agents.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@femto/applescript-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
